website_summaries.verdict: Despite some quality concern, these balls are worth considering if you need a large quantity at a decent price for practice or learning the fundamentals of the game.
pros: 60 pressureless balls is an unbeatable deal
Also a good choice for tennis ball machines
Ideal for practice or casual play
cons: Not a good pick for tournaments or highly-skilled players
Have a strange smell that may fade with use
Some faulty balls have been reported

customer_reviews.title: These work great for tennis lessons
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to use for tennis lessons w/ my sons & their friends. These work great for tennis lessons. Was going to get the "color-coded" balls for lessons, but those are pretty expensive. These balls may be "pressure less", but they work just fine, bounce good, etc. esp. for tennis lessons with younger kiddos. I probably wouldn't play matches w/ these, but otherwise, they work great.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Cosner Fox

customer_reviews.title: a practice pressure-less ball that comes the closets to real pressure balls.
customer_reviews.text: The pressure-less ball brand that comes the closest equivalent to real pressure balls. I previously ordered the PENN pressure-less balls and they do not bounce no where near a real pressure ball and they are super "heavy" feeling. These Tourna balls are definitely "softer" and bouncier and easy on the joint/elebow compared to all outer pressure-less balls I've used in the past. I use these in my Lobster ball machine and highly recommend them, especially to those looking for a practice pressure-less ball that comes the closets to real pressure balls.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki H.

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these twice and this will be my third time. They bounce higher and closer to a regular ball bounce than the Penn balls, so I prefer these out of the box. They work well for practice and store forever, but after a couple of months of hard use the fuzz will start to come off and the bounce becomes more irregular. The Penn balls wear better, but all in all, I like these a bit more. Plus, the red logo is distinctive and easy to separate the balls from other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Aardvark

customer_reviews.title: These Balls are OK
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to run through my tennis ball machine and used them for a good while, but have gone back to using regular tennis balls. They really left a LOT of fuzz in my machine and I had to vacuum out large bunches of it. They felt pretty much like regular tennis balls when hit with a racquet - maybe a little more force was needed, and sometimes they bounced weird, but that was o.k. since real tennis balls can bounce weird too. I may start using them again since they seem to have a lot of life left in them, but probably won't be buying anymore.
customer_reviews.author: loveguitarTop Contributor: Soap Making

customer_reviews.title: The Best pressureless balls
customer_reviews.text: For years I have used Penn pressureless balls for my ball machine but were hard on the elbows. Then i tried the Tretorn balls but were too expensive. These Tourna balls are soft on the elbow and is the most inexpensive. Yes it does have a few balls that are not perfect but feels good for my elbow and wallet. I notice that after working out with my ball machine the ball's fur left on the court is much less compared to Penn and Tretorn. Ball seems to be more durable. I would have to do another review in the future.I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin G

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have always bought Gamma pressureless tennis balls to hit with my kids. This time I thought I try out the Tourna pressureless balls because it was cheaper than the Gamma brand but it’s been a disappointment. Only had these balls for a few months but they don’t bounce like my old Gamma ones that are easily over 2+ years old. Would go back to Gamma again next time even if it is a little more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Chen

customer_reviews.title: Ball machine will tear cover off
customer_reviews.text: The first few times using in the ball machine, these seemed great, except that as some others have said, the bounce and trajectory were sometimes unpredictable because of small imperfections. But then, if regularly hit with topspin, the cover of the balls started tearing off in patches and the balls' surface generally became tufted and irregular. This never happened with Penn Pressureless balls. Will not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Great for hitting balls with a bat for fun!
customer_reviews.text: I don't use these for tennis, I actually use them to smash balls around with a baseball bat in my neighborhood. These tend to go almost two times as far when I hit them which was an added plus for me. Makes me look like a beast to the little kids on the block when I knock one two blocks over! ahaha
customer_reviews.author: Dob

customer_reviews.title: Excellent foam balls.
customer_reviews.text: These balls seem to be just like the ones with air and yet they will never go flat! To be honest, I am not sure if I would ever use them for a real tennis game, but they are perfect to use to teach new tennis players the games. In the past, I used traditional balls which would frequently go flat which annoys everyone. Problem solved with these beauties!
customer_reviews.author: Jay L

customer_reviews.title: Great for Dogs!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for my Military Working Dog Retirement ceremony. Everyone sitting in the front got to toss a ball at him after the closing remarks. He lost his mind and couldn’t of been happier!
customer_reviews.author: Zachory B

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't die out like normal tennis balls
customer_reviews.text: I love these balls and bought them three times. Use them for teaching my kids. What's so great about them is that they still bounce after years. I still have some balls that I started using when my daughter was 8 and now she is 12. The only downside is that they bounce much higher than regular tennis balls. These wouldn't be great practice balls for any tournament player.
customer_reviews.author: Rana R.

customer_reviews.title: I like this sack of balls
customer_reviews.text: These work pretty well and are pretty tough. I use them for serve practice, so I can't speak to their durability in a machine, but for me, they are more than adequate. They bounce reasonably close to moderately fresh balls.
customer_reviews.author: DrThunder88

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with my purchase of these tennis balls
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with my purchase of these tennis balls! The # you get for the price cannot be beat, and where they are "nonpressurized," they still feel new. I use them with my Pete Sampras hopper, for which they are perfect. The odor of the balls when they first arrive is indeed strong, but hardly a reason to dock a star. I simply left them outside on the porch for 2 days, and the smell dissipated pretty much entirely. I was reluctant at first to purchase these, given the price to ball ratio. In hindsight, I am extremely glad I did.
customer_reviews.author: Petar Leonard

customer_reviews.title: I would have never imagine a pressureless ball will feel like a new crisp pressurized ball from a can
customer_reviews.text: I read most of the reviews stating of the uneven bounce of this balls. They are quiet bouncy, but bounce evenly. However even the slightiest imperfection on the ground the ball will notice it and will bounce accordingly. I would have never imagine a pressureless ball will feel like a new crisp pressurized ball from a can. I'll repost on how they play with a couple of month of use.
customer_reviews.author: Cesar Cardenas

customer_reviews.title: Unpredictable Bounce
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these tennis balls to use with my new Lobster ball machine. But I also tried playing tennis with them. That is when I noticed that if I dropped one of these balls on the tennis court, you could not predict the direction of the bounce back up. This is also apparent in the wide ranging directions of the balls out of the ball machine and the irregular bounce when they hit the court. I will not be buying any more of this brand of balls. I suspect that the balls are not uniformly round.
customer_reviews.author: Charles S.

customer_reviews.title: Best price I have seen and came quickly as promised.
customer_reviews.text: I’m not sure why most people buy tennis balls, but these made my dog(s) so happy just now. 😊. I’m going to rinse them off for him and as soon as he “pops” it we take it away so he doesn’t get a chunk/ choke ... before all the concerned people want to tell me about how I should not give my dog tennis balls.
customer_reviews.author: tory biasotti

customer_reviews.title: Defective - See Photos. Can be used for dog toys though ;)
customer_reviews.text: There is a raised ridge through the circumference of everyball in the pack. You can see this in the photos. They are useless as far as being used to play tennis because of this. Took them out to play 32 days after I bought them so Amazon won’t accept a return after 30 days. My dogs now have a lifetimes worth off tennis balls. If you’re looking for a better ball the treton micro- x is good, but more expensive. You get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Heaven, she's in heaven..
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my border collie Ruby. Great dog chase balls and she's comforted by having a seemingly endless supply. She thinks of them as "ball passes". As long as you have a tennis ball in your little doggie mouth you can go anywhere and do anything under the guise of "retreiving the ball".
customer_reviews.author: Mary OZ

customer_reviews.title: Avoid If You Plan To Use Them As Tennis Balls!
customer_reviews.text: These may work fine for those of you who plan to use these balls with your dog or on the bottom of a chair but for their intended purpose- as tennis balls- they are complete garbage. I bought 120 balls for my ball machine and about a month later 75% of the balls have a rip in the cover. They also left glue residue on my strings which resulted in strings breaking prematurely. The best pressureless balls I have tried are from Tretorn. They are expensive but last forever. I tried to save some money by going with these and failed. Avoid!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sounded like a good idea but definitely not durable.
customer_reviews.text: These balls are definitely not very durable and are a bad replacement for traditional tennis ball designs. I guess I did not do my homework and expected something better so on this occasion I lost money. Beware before you buy these, just make sure they are right for you otherwise it will be a small loss.
customer_reviews.author: Smith

customer_reviews.title: Underwhelming product.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product about a year ago and product was outstanding. A purchase on July, 2018 was disappointing. Balls seem to be of two halves and balls are failing along seem. Would not buy again based on recent purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Syracuse Indiana

customer_reviews.title: Great for dogs
customer_reviews.text: It is always our dogs favorite day when the new bag of tennis balls arrive. We launch these all over and they bounce great and stand up to lots of chewing. Will buy again and again.
customer_reviews.author: Lori L Goforth

customer_reviews.title: Horrible smell. Intended for dog but unsure now due to chemical smell.
customer_reviews.text: Great for tennis I suppose but the smell from these was so strong, it burned my nose before even opening the box. They stunk up the whole room inside my house. I washed them and soaked them in soap and water and it took a bit of the edge off. Will have to wash them in the washing machine or soak baking soda with them. I intended on giving them to my dog but I'm afraid of what they're made out of with a pungent chemical smell this strong!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked well (hit with bats!!)
customer_reviews.text: I wanted an inexpensive tennis ball for eye drills for softball players (I’m a professional coach). I wrote #’s on balls and they are trying to read the # prior to finishing swing. In one week, balls were hit at least 1,500 times both composite bats (girls ranging from 8-18). They worked great with zero issues!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: But these are fantastic. Our dog is obsessed with her tennis balls ...
customer_reviews.text: Ok. I will not admit how often these are bought. But these are fantastic. Our dog is obsessed with her tennis balls and these are perfect to have, once they get too "naked" or holely they are tossed out and there are plenty more to replace them with this packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Wiff

customer_reviews.title: Ok, felt comes off. But stay bouncy
customer_reviews.text: Balls stay hard and bounce, but felt comes off rather quickly. I use these in my ball machine along with normal balls. The normal balls all keep their felt, but obviously lose their bounce after time. Most of the Tourna balls are still hard as a rock, but the felt is coming off.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My Border Collie loves them.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second order I have made for these balls, My dog loves to play ball in the back yard and we tend to loose balls on a regular basis.
customer_reviews.author: Keitters

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd set of Tourna Pressureless Tennis Ball (Pack of 60) That I have bought for our ball machine this year. I do not recommend them. I thought the 1st set of balls not bouncing well was a fluke. The same with the 2nd set. Not impressed with them at all.
customer_reviews.author: Tish

customer_reviews.title: Great for dogs.
customer_reviews.text: Listen..these were for our dogs. They were THRILLED. They don't last super long, but our dogs love killing toys. Still worth it.
customer_reviews.author: AuntieEm91

customer_reviews.title: I bought these for a tennis ball obsessed pooch. ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a tennis ball obsessed pooch. They were much cheaper to buy than the balls in the pet store. I also use them in the dryer to fluff up the clothes.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy
customer_reviews.text: The mesh bag came ripped, but to me that was no big deal. These were for my black lab who can never have too many tennis balls. She gives them an A+
customer_reviews.author: Felicia G.

customer_reviews.title: All the reviews I had seen were on how good the balls are for the dogs
customer_reviews.text: All the reviews I had seen were on how good the balls are for the dogs, I literally thought for 100 times before buying them. From my research, I found that pressureless balls do not bounce much, but they are really good interns of the bounce, they are really good if you are looking to practice. Do not think much you can go ahead and order them.
customer_reviews.author: Sai Karan

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy these balls
customer_reviews.text: I rarely write reviews but you need to know that these balls are not good quality. After 3-4 uses in machine, the fuzz was all over my machine and my pickup tubes won't pickup these balls because they're smaller than a regular ball. Buy the name brand balls - you'll thank me later.
customer_reviews.author: Paul and Regina

customer_reviews.title: Big bounce small price
customer_reviews.text: Great bang for your buck. Work great no the tennis court and filled up our hopper. They are bouncing great and definitely serve their purpose. They seem to be holding air. Overall I'm pleased
customer_reviews.author: Boca Girl

customer_reviews.title: Great for dogs!
customer_reviews.text: If you have trouble finding good durable balls for dogs, these are great. I have a boxer who LOVES tennis balls and the store ones break so easily within a day. With these i give her atleast one every few weeks. So far its been several months since i purchased them last and still have half of the bag left. So great toys for dogs.
customer_reviews.author: ashley

customer_reviews.title: Not Holding Up
customer_reviews.text: I've bought pressureless balls in the past from Penn and they were excellent for practice. I thought I'd try these since they were cheaper but never again. After a month, the fuzz has turned to little pellets that falls off and leaves them with far less cover than the Penns after a year of use. In addition, several of them have a rattle in them after being used as if something is coming apart inside. Don't waste your money on these if you're going to buy practice balls. Spend a few bucks more and buy Penn.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Great when not damaged
customer_reviews.text: Bought two packs so that I could almost completely fill my ball machine. I had none that were broken upon delivery. However, after my very first session, I would say about 7-10 now had cracks and were damaged. Pressureless balls are heavily used in ball machines and should be durable enough to handle this. Work well but dont be surprised if they damage easily.
customer_reviews.author: Zachariah viles

customer_reviews.title: Great for dogs
customer_reviews.text: Great gift for the dogs. Our dog is a strong chewer and destroys these, but it keeps him occupied. I still have lots left, and for this price I don't mind giving them to him for a quick disposable distraction.
customer_reviews.author: Mark D. Davis

customer_reviews.title: No horrible smells
customer_reviews.text: Bought these in Feb 2017 with fingers crossed after reading all the reviews about horrible odors. Pleased to say they arrived with no smell whatsoever to our East Coast location. We use them for backyard baseball practice - hitting, pitching, catching, etc, with our young children. They take the worry out of a bonk in the head from a missed catch or a something broken/dented from a batted ball.
customer_reviews.author: Mojo Rising

customer_reviews.title: Ball Machine Balls
customer_reviews.text: Purchase was for our ball machine. They last a long time and work perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: danhopkinsjd

customer_reviews.title: My dog is very happy!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how well these hold up for tennis. I bought a big case of them for my dog, wrapped them up and gave them to my doggie for Christmas. She's happy, I'm happy (they were much cheaper than what I was getting her) so it's a win.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Pressured vs. Pressureless Balls
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a ball machine and seem to work perfectly. Maybe I am not a good enough player but I notice very little difference between these and pressured balls. Work great in my Lobster.
customer_reviews.author: ReedIII

customer_reviews.title: Good for batting
customer_reviews.text: We use them for batting practice for my daughter. Perfect for that use.
customer_reviews.author: davidah64d

customer_reviews.title: Great for the dog park
customer_reviews.text: You can't beat the price of these balls especially since we loose one every time we go to a dog park.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Whiteman

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gift for a Golden Retriever
customer_reviews.text: Our 15 year old golden retriever was thrilled with her Christmas present. Still have quite a few remaining!
customer_reviews.author: B G

customer_reviews.title: Balls are balls
customer_reviews.text: Dogs love balls! These do not last as long as the last set I purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Best buy
customer_reviews.text: These tennis balls are not popping when my dogs play with them!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They bounce fine for dog play!
customer_reviews.text: The net bag was cut open on mine so don't count on having that-- it's not sturdy enough to hold this many balls anyway really. I used an empty powder detergent bucket (empty kitty litter bucket would work too) to move them all into so I have something with a lid and a handle to keep by the door or carry around the yard to collect balls.
customer_reviews.author: P. Caldwell

customer_reviews.title: Great Balls  of Fire.
customer_reviews.text: These balls are strong, sturdy and great for practice or dispensing at the Dog park and sharing a fun time with the canines.
customer_reviews.author: xx SUGANO

customer_reviews.title: Great balls for dogs? Not so much...
customer_reviews.text: Multiple reviews said these tennis balls, while perhaps not the highest of quality, are great for dogs. But my dog can rip one of these apart in a hot minute, compared with a brand-name tennis ball that generally lasts 2-3 days. (And no, he's not a pit bull). So a word of caution to anyone with an energetic dog that loves to play: These balls will not hold up!
customer_reviews.author: John Chambers

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my son's teacher because it was on her wish list for the students chairs. Worked perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves them and it takes longer for her to chew them up
customer_reviews.author: Sharon L. Da Silva

customer_reviews.title: Expected better. Poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: Balls so dead out of bag (and having been kept at room temp) that guys on next court said they couldn't stand the sound and gave us a few of their new Wilsons to use. Many of them bounced of to left or right when dropped due to product quality. Waste of $. Balls to recycling bin sadly.
customer_reviews.author: dag

customer_reviews.title: Great for serve practice
customer_reviews.text: Great for serve practice, novice players/children and dogs. If you're a tennis pro or merely effete, you'll likely find these sub par for one reason or another.
customer_reviews.author: RJF

customer_reviews.title: Dog Heaven
customer_reviews.text: Our dogs love the heck out of these balls. We buy bulk as it is cheaper and they last for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlyn Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value. Use for my dogs. Maybe tennis one day
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Buy Penns instead
customer_reviews.text: Buy Penns for your ball machine if you are looking for best quality/economy. Tretorn's if price is not a factor.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Simms

customer_reviews.title: Affordable tennis balls
customer_reviews.text: Great practice balls. Probably had 3-5 with funny bumps but doesn’t make a huge difference for practice and rallying. Highly recommend this for the price quality and quantity
customer_reviews.author: gene

customer_reviews.title: Bulk Balls
customer_reviews.text: Great bulk price for practice balls for all uses: tennis, dog, chasing off deer from my plants ....
customer_reviews.author: Farrside

customer_reviews.title: Okay
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't seem quite as sturdy / durable as the last pack I purchased - but still at deal for the money to keep my dog entertained.
customer_reviews.author: Joni Watling

customer_reviews.title: Loved the value for price and made great additions to ...
customer_reviews.text: Loved the value for price and made great additions to the Operation Christmas Child shoeboxes packed by my church. These balls will give hours of happiness to children somewhere across the world, as will the message of Jesus Christ that accompanies them.
customer_reviews.author: Lissette Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: I don't know if this is typical for airless tennis ...
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if this is typical for airless tennis balls or not, but they definitely seem a little heavier than a normal tennis ball. They bounce well.
customer_reviews.author: MICHAEL W.

customer_reviews.title: ... these in the lobster ball machine and they work great. no stuck balls not jams
customer_reviews.text: used these in the lobster ball machine and they work great. no stuck balls not jams. good bounce
customer_reviews.author: C. Fountain

customer_reviews.title: My dog was so excited
customer_reviews.text: My dog could smell what this was immediately and tried to open the box.
customer_reviews.author: michael hulme

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality - do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: Tennis balls are VERY poor quality - tore and ripped after 2 uses- don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: Peggy

customer_reviews.title: Bad apples
customer_reviews.text: One bad ball in each of 2 packs. Never encountered a bad ball in several previous purchases of a competing brand. But they are cheaper, so maybe one bad out of 60 is acceptable. We'll see how they hold up.
customer_reviews.author: D. Fox

customer_reviews.title: Checked pricing on many other balls and this was the best deal that I found
customer_reviews.text: Needed a bag of tennis balls for the dogs to play with. Checked pricing on many other balls and this was the best deal that I found. Now I have hours of ball chasing fun to be had with the dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Laura L

customer_reviews.title: Should tennis balls be spherical?
customer_reviews.text: There are many balls! Only a problem if you think tennis balls should be round. These are oval.
customer_reviews.author: CarolinaNole🏈

customer_reviews.title: Balls don't last a day
customer_reviews.text: I bought these balls and first time using them with my ball machine 5 of them popped. Prior to these I used a 2 cases of gamma practice balls and not a single one popped. The bounce also appears to very irregular. Dont but these get the gamma bucket.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Schley

customer_reviews.title: Great deal for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Use these constantly for the dogs at the dog park. Great for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Jesus Freak II

customer_reviews.title: Great value for a large #!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, needed a bunch to fill up our ball hopper and these fit the bill! No issues!
customer_reviews.author: Jen RH

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these as a Christmas Gift for my brothers dog and they seem as good as any know brands. They have a good Fresh Tennis Ball Smell.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: These tennis balls have made my 2 girls some very happy puppies.
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 dogs...need I say more? Ok I will... I bounced the first 3 right over the back wall within 3 1/2 minutes! These tennis balls have made my 2 girls some very happy puppies.
customer_reviews.author: C-💰 🍯🌿

customer_reviews.title: Great deal.
customer_reviews.text: 60 balls, just as good as the big name brand tennis balls. The dogs love them... all 60 of them!
customer_reviews.author: Allison Vaccaro

customer_reviews.title: Jus perfect
customer_reviews.text: Just on time and as is looks on the web
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for our Dogs
customer_reviews.text: Great for our Dogs! I know they won't last especially with my GSD. The quantity and price are right. Would have given 5 starts, HOWEVER the bag was open when I opened the box and after a quick count only 55 tennis balls. Clearly bag and order says 60! I would like my 5 tennis balls that I paid for and did not receive!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Using them for my wifes walker
customer_reviews.text: Don't know if the good for tennis but they work great for dogs to play with and on the bottom of my wife's walker feet.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent price and product! My dog loves these and can’t destroy them in 10 seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good balls for tennis pro lite machine
customer_reviews.text: We used these balls for our tennis pro lite machine. They worked very well in the machine and kept us hopping on the court!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Miller

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bought them for a school party - the kids *loved* them!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dead balls
customer_reviews.text: I like having a lot of balls, but there seems to be a lot of dead balls in my bag, or after using them for about 2 weeks, 3 times a week for about 1.5 hours I've busted them or they just go flat. Try them for you're self. I'm switching today.
customer_reviews.author: Rosemary Barton

customer_reviews.title: Great Item
customer_reviews.text: These balls are nearly the same as pressure balls. They are worth the money if you have a ball machine. I would buy again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: I used in them in my new Lobster ball machine ...
customer_reviews.text: I used in them in my new Lobster ball machine and they were practically in schreads after only 3 weeks. Of course, I did use them everyday - But 3 weeks! (Pitiful)!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to be cut and used on my husband's walker. They hold up longer than many brands.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara W. Alling

customer_reviews.title: Happy Customer
customer_reviews.text: These seem to be good quality tennis balls. I've used them several times with my son, and they seem to hold up well and seem to be of good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Rich P.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product whose quality greatly exceeds its price
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product whose quality greatly exceeds its price. The tennis balls are extremely resilient and wiil easily hold up under "fire". I reccomend thus product to anyone who needs high quality rebound at a price that beats many of the name brands. Will order more without hesitation!
customer_reviews.author: Puppet Master

customer_reviews.title: Happiness for my doggie
customer_reviews.text: My lab goes through a ball a day... the price is right
customer_reviews.author: karyn Morris

customer_reviews.title: Bought these for my dogs and they love them. Not the best tennis balls
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my dogs and they love them. Not the best tennis balls, but in this case it really doesn't matter.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: So many tennis balls!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this product for our dogs. We keep an average of 6 tennis balls in the yard to toss around to our 3 dogs who go crazy for them. Really nice to have a bunch to replace the tennis balls that the dogs have crushed and chewed apart.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna Clark

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: Good balls if you want to play with your dog, bad if you intend to use them for tennis. Balls don’t bounce straight, most have bumps, strips, and irregularities. Better to spend some extra money and buy penn balls.
customer_reviews.author: Dee M.

customer_reviews.title: Balls "cracked" within the first two hours of use
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for use with a tennis ball machine. Within the first two hours, 5 or 6 had split internally. The felt was still intact but the rubber ball inside had broken at the seam. Several more have broken within a month. I've used other pressureless balls that don't have this problem
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey Pettengill

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love them
customer_reviews.text: Bag full of tennis balls, ok quality but perfect for the dogs. So I give them 5 stars for the price
customer_reviews.author: Matt Crisafulli

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Single use tennis balls. After playing catch with my dog for less than a half an hour it breaks into 2 halves. They last about 1/10 of the time as tennis balls I have used in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Cory

customer_reviews.title: Very much like tennis balls
customer_reviews.text: Good price and I do prefer them to the penn pressureless balls. They seem to bounce better and feel more 'tennis ball like'
customer_reviews.author: Randy in DC

customer_reviews.title: Not the same size as a regular tennis ball.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 120 of these balls for my ball machine. When they arrived I noticed right away they are much smaller than a regular tennis ball. They seem to bounce decent but smaller. Sent them back.
customer_reviews.author: jing

customer_reviews.title: They do smell pretty funky though
customer_reviews.text: The dog went insane for these! We dumped the whole bag out on the floor and she didn't know what to do. They do smell pretty funky though!
customer_reviews.author: Shawn F.

customer_reviews.title: A dog’s perspective
customer_reviews.text: As dog balls they’re better than pet store balls, but not as durable as regular pressurized balls. Can’t speak about durability for their intended purpose. Sorry.
customer_reviews.author: TOM HOLLAND

customer_reviews.title: Tennis balls well worth it!
customer_reviews.text: We didn’t know the difference between pressured and non pressured balls until we did some research. Very happy with our purchase as we use these for practice
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Great for the dog!
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my tennis ball obsessed corgi. He likes them and they last about a week so I'm not complaining. Will probably purchase again if available when we need more
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: Balls don't last long.
customer_reviews.text: If you have a ball machine don't buy these balls - I've had these balls for 6 months and they are don't have a good bounce anymore. Buy Tretorn they last for a year or two.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte K.

product_meta.title: Tourna Pressureless Tennis Ball (Pack of 60)
product_meta.description: Tourna Pressure less tennis balls never go dead and include 60 bulk tennis balls per pack. They are ideal for practice and for throwing machines. Pressure-less means they never go dead, which makes them great for tennis practice, ball machines, filling up ball baskets and hoppers, or just making sure your pet has hours of fun chasing these balls. They fit Chuck-it style Dog ball launchers and automatic ball launchers. Durable rubber and a premium felt ensures their use Can be universal, Whether your a budding tennis player or a pet Owner.
feature_bullets: TOURNA PRESSURLESS BALLS NEVER LOSE THEIR BOUNCE. Regular tennis balls go flat over time, even if you don’t use them. These balls will have the same consistent bounce for the life of the ball.

DURABLE! Not all tennis balls are created equal. The extra durable felt on the TOURNA Pressurless tennis balls lasts a long time. Ideal for tennis ball machines, tennis practice, or even playing with your pets.
60 HIGH QUALITY PRESSURLESS BALLS PER BAG
Ideal for practice, ball throwing machines, or playing with your pet.

REGULATION SIZE AND BOUNCE. Tourna tennis balls are regulation size and bounce to regulation height. Many pressureless balls are smaller than a regular ball. Play and practice with confidence on all surfaces with Tourna Pressureless Tennis Balls.
